election of such utility to be selfinsured and if such utility provides satisfactory proof not later than january 10 of each year that the utility does in fact have such net worth any such certificate making of any street excavation pursuant to this article that is made by such public utility its agents or employees or by any subcontractor of such public utility or by anyone directly or indirectly employed by such public utility 4 excavation administration and inspection fee an excavation administration and inspection fee of $500 shall be charged for each excavation permit an excavation permit must be issued for each portion of the work of continuous trench within the public place 5 incomplete or defective work  street surface restoration fund a incomplete or defective work any person or permittee who performs work to which this article applies is required to correct any work which is found to be incomplete or which contains defective materials or defective workmanship for a period of three years from the date such work was completed and accepted by the city if the person performing such work fails to correct incomplete or defective work within ten days of city notification to such person and upon failure of such person to complete such work or correct such deficiency the city may at its election complete such work and bill the person performing the work for work required to be done by the city b schedules for payment to street surface restoration fund excavations shall not be made in any city street or public place unless required by absolute necessity or due to an emergency when an excavation is required in a city street or in a public place a payment shall be made to a street surface restoration fund based on the following schedules 1 newly constructed street no excavation permit will be issued except for emergencies or upon a showing of absolute necessity for any street that has not been in service for five years prior to the date of the proposed excavation if excavation is required due to an emergency or is of a nature deemed absolutely necessary by the community development director to be performed within such fiveyear period payment to the surface street restoration fund shall be made by the person who caused the excavation to be required based upon the city annual street maintenance contract cost for the full street width the full length of the excavation plus an additional 30 feet at each end of such excavation 2 streets constructed five to eight years prior to excavation if a street was constructed more than five but less than eight years prior to the proposed excavation or if the street proposed for excavation was overlaid heater remixed or otherwise was the subject of major maintenance within a period of three years prior to the proposed excavation payment to the street surface restoration fund shall be made based upon the current city annual street maintenance contract for onehalf of the width of the street the full length of the excavation plus an additional 30 feet at each end of the excavation 3 streets with major maintenance within three to five years from date of proposed excavation if a street shall have been the subject of major maintenance not less than three or more than five years from the date of the proposed excavation payment to the street surface restoration fund based upon the current city annual street maintenance contract shall be made for onequarter of the width of the street the full length of the excavation plus 30 feet at each end of the excavation 4 other streets excavations in streets which are not defined in subsections b1 2 and 3 of this section do not require payment into the street surface restoration fund c compliance with standards payment to the street surface restoration fund shall be in addition to any requirement of this article that excavations and street repairs be performed pursuant to standards established by the community development director for excavation substructure entrance street repair and pavement patching d use of funds the city shall use funds deposited in the street surface restoration fund for resurfacing the city streets and resurfacing areas which have been damaged due to excessive excavation activity e exemption from fund deposits due to the street surface restoration fund are not required where excavation is not made into an asphalt or concrete surfaced street 6 waiver of permit or payment to street surface restoration fund a the city manager may waive the requirement of obtaining a permit under this article or surface line designed to serve a single property owner each person having any interest in such substructure must at least 30 days prior to such abandonment file with the community development director a statement in writing giving in detail the location of the substructure proposed to be abandoned unless otherwise provided by law the city or the state or any agency or political subdivision thereof may at any time thereafter require such person to remove at the expense of such person the abandoned substructure or the city at its sole election may remove such substructure and such person shall then reimburse the city for the cost of removal from any public place 12 protection of adjoining property any person subject to this article shall at all times and at such persons own expense preserve and protect from injury any adjoining property by taking suitable measures for that purpose where in the protection of such property it is necessary to enter upon private property for the purpose of taking appropriate protection measures such person shall unless otherwise provided by law obtain permission from the owner of such private property persons subject to this article must at the expense of such person shore up and protect all buildings walls fences or other property which may be damaged during the progress of the excavation work and shall be responsible for all damages to private property resulting from failure of the person subject to this article to properly protect and carry out such work such person may not remove even temporarily any tree or shrub which exists in any public place without first obtaining the permission of the community development director 13 care of excavated material a all material excavated pursuant to this article and that is piled adjacent to the excavation or in any public place must be piled and maintained so as not to endanger the public and those working in the excavation and so as to cause as little inconvenience as possible to those persons using the public place and the adjoining property all excavations shall comply with applicable city ordinances and rules and regulations all material excavated must be laid completely along the side of the excavation and shall be kept trimmed so as to cause as little inconvenience as is reasonably possible to vehicle and pedestrian traffic unless otherwise directed by the community development director excavated material may not be used as a barricade in order to expedite the flow of traffic or to keep dirt and dust from spreading or flying the person subject to this article shall use guards or other methods to maintain dirt and dust control or shall appropriately water and keep wet such excavated material b traffic markings removed as a part of the excavation shall be replaced with materials similar to those originally in place and in the manner satisfactory to the community development director the city may in its sole discretion elect to replace such traffic markings and to charge such expense to the person making such excavation 14 cleanup each person subject to this article shall thoroughly clean up all rubbish excess earth rock and other debris resulting from excavation work and from the public place all cleanup operations at the location of such excavation shall be accomplished at the expense of the person subject to this article and in compliance with section 24516 during the progress of the work the community development director may order immediately after completion of such work and at the expense of the person making the excavation the person subject to this article to clean up and remove all refuse dirt and unused material of any kind resulting from such work upon failure to do so within 24 hours after having been notified in writing to do so the community development director may cause such cleanup work to be done and the cost thereof to be charged to the person responsible therefor 15 protection of drainageways any person subject to this article shall maintain all gutters easement crossings and related drainageways free and unobstructed for the full depth and width thereof or shall provide adequate substitutes for any such watercourses which may be blocked by any excavation 16 breaking a under this article the use of pavement breakers which endanger existing structures or other property or which produce noise levels in violation of of are unlawful and prohibited b saw cutting of concrete may be required by the community development director when the nature of the job or condition of the street warrants if saw cutting is required the depth of the cut must be at least onethird the total thickness of the pavement c sidewalks or curb and gutter are to be removed to the nearest expansion joint score line or saw cut edge sidewalk cuts parallel to the street shall normally require removal of the entire sidewalk unless other methods are approved in writing in advance by the community development director d unstable pavement must be removed over caveins and the subgrade shall be treated in the same manner as the main excavation e pavement edges must be trimmed to a vertical face and neatly aligned with the centerline of any trench all cuts shall be parallel or perpendicular to the street except for drop inlet connection lines f the person subject to this article shall not be required to repair damage which existed prior to the excavation unless the cut made by such person leaves small floating sections which are unstable in which case such person shall remove such sections and backfill such areas as well as the area of excavation g all such excavations shall be accomplished according to standards developed by the community development director and approved by the city council 17 depth of structures under this article the minimum cover of any new substructure excepting lawful entrances thereto shall be in accordance with approved utility location drawings for such streets unless otherwise permitted in writing by the community development director nothing in this section shall impose a duty upon any person owning a utility to maintain the depth required in this section upon subsequent changes in grade in the surface unless in the opinion of the community development director the grade of such substructure interferes with the public safety or maintenance of or travel upon a public place in which event the substructure shall be lowered by and at the expense of the owner of the utility 18 backfilling unless specifically exempted in writing by the community development director any person who trenches or excavates on or within a public place for any purpose whatsoever shall be required to backfill the trench or excavation as follows 1 in all trenches or excavations the material used in backfilling must consist of the original excavated material or other material as required by the community development director in a finely divided form free from large lumps large stones rocks pieces of old concrete or asphalt pavement or large wet or gummy masses and must be placed compacted in layers or lifts as provided in this section from the bottom of the trench or excavation to the top of the trench or excavation 2 each layer or lift shall be placed evenly level and of such depth that the degree of compaction as required in this section may be obtained throughout the entire backfill without exceeding the depth of layer or lift as recommended by the manufacturer of the compaction equipment being used for the various soil types encountered or as determined by actual compaction tests of the lift or layer in place or as directed by the community development director in no event shall the method of compaction being used cause damage to a pipeline or other subsurface structure in the trench excavation or any property adjacent thereto 3 each lift or layer must be sufficiently moistened so that when compacted moisture content shall meet the following requirements a the backfill material when placed in a trench must be thoroughly compacted to a minimum of 90 percent of maximum density entire depth of the excavation or trench with the exception that the top six inches in residential streets and the top 12 inches in arterial streets must be compacted to a maximum of 95 percent of maximum density b tests for compliance with this subsection shall be performed by the city or by a laboratory approved by the city the 95 percent of maximum density requirements may be waived if the backfill or subgrade material contains 35 percent or more of material passing the no 200 sieve in which case the compaction must be not less than 90 percent of maximum density c the moisture content of the backfill material in place must not exceed the optimum by more than two percent or be less than the optimum by more than five percent unless otherwise directed by the community development director d obtaining of the correct moisture content is the responsibility of the person doing the trench or excavation backfill e optimum moisture and maximum density shall be determined in accordance with the american society for testing and materials astm d1577 including all revisions thereof costs for such testing shall be paid for by the person doing the trench or excavation backfill 4 when a trench or excavation has been cut pavement the compaction for the top six inches and 12 inches as referred to in subsection 3 of this section shall mean the six inches or 12 inches of material which is placed immediately below the bottom or base of the existing pavement slab the remainder of the backfill up to the top of the existing pavement surface is to be compacted sufficiently to provide a level and safe riding surface and shall be maintained in that condition by the person making the excavation until the permanent pavement patch can be placed which shall in any event be done within a period of ten days 5 backfill and compaction inspection must be made as required by the community development director the community development director is authorized to make or to have made backfill moisture density tests for the purpose of determining compliance with the compaction requirements of this section such tests are to be made in accordance with the standard procedures of the american standards for testing and materials astm including the latest revisions thereof all costs connected with this testing shall be done at the expense of the person doing the actual backfill and compaction work 6 if the completed backfill fails to meet the density requirements of this section when tested or otherwise fails as evidenced by settlement of the trench or excavation the community development director may order the faulty backfill material removed replaced and recompacted to the required density specified in this section and retested at the expense of the person originally responsible for such backfill the community development director may also order the replacement of all pavement destroyed or damaged as the result of backfill failure settlement 7 if a person responsible fails to comply with the requirements of this section the city manager may after notice to the responsible person and the opportunity to be heard refuse to grant any further permit to such person to thereafter engage in trenching or excavation in any public place the city manager shall subject to appeal to the administrative review board be authorized and empowered following a hearing and the opportunity to be heard suspend cancel or withdraw a license or permit issued for the performance of any work which is not done in accordance with this article or to the reasonable satisfaction of the community development director 19 restoration of surface a upon completion of the backfilling of any excavation made pursuant to this article the permittee shall notify the community development director permanent resurfacing shall be done by the responsible person if qualified or by city forces at cost or by the citys contractor under the street maintenance contract as directed by the community development director the community development director shall establish a minimum charge for work of less than one square yard the cost of all resurfacing shall be borne by the responsible person the responsible person must resurface the excavation within a period of ten days after acceptance of density tests by the city if the city has accepted the responsibility for pavement resurfacing the person responsible must keep each excavation safe for pedestrian and vehicle traffic for ten days after giving notice of completion of backfilling unless a longer period is required due to extreme weather conditions in any case the person accepting the responsibility for restoring the pavement surface remains responsible for keeping the excavation safe for pedestrian and vehicular traffic until the pavement surface has been accepted by the city b acceptance or approval of excavation work or backfilling by the community development director shall not prevent the city from asserting a claim against the person responsible for incomplete or defective workmanship or material which may occur within three years from the date of completion and city acceptance of the excavation work or backfilling the presence of the community development director during the performance of any work shall not relieve the person responsible from responsibility under this subsection c when permits are issued for work on arterial collector downtown or important streets which may be designed by the community development director all such streets shall be patched with temporary asphalt or approved bridging across the excavation at the end of each working day and shall be opened to traffic unless other procedures are approved in advance by the community development director d in order to allow easy identification of restoration work a sixinch diameter spray painted area shall be placed at each end of the work colored as follows 1 city identifies liquid waste green 2 city identifies water blue 3 city identifies storm sewer green and white 4 telephone systems identifies telephone lines orange 5 cable television system formerly teleprompter identifies cable tv orange and white 6 city identifies electric lines red 7 natural gas utility identifies gas lines yellow 8 city identifies traffic control lines orange and black 9 city identifies fire lines orange and gray 20 completion methods the requirements of sections 24519 24520 and 24521 must be completed by one of the following methods 1 by the person responsible provided the qualifications of such person to do so have been approved by the community development director in writing as to adequate equipment personnel and knowledge of backfilling and surfacing methods 2 by any person who has first been approved by the community development director in writing as to qualifications and provided such person complies with all sections of this article which relate to responsible persons the qualifications referred to in this subsection being the same as those referred to in subsection 1 of this section 3 by city forces provided the person responsible requests the city in writing to do any or all portions of the work a11 secs 246524630  reserved division 2  permit required no person shall engage in participate in aid form or start any parade unless a parade permit shall have been obtained from the chief of police this section shall not apply to the following 1 funeral processions 2 students going to and from school classes or participating in educational activities provided that such conduct is under the immediate direction and supervision of the proper school authorities 3 a governmental agency acting within the scope of its functions 4 sidewalk processions which observe and comply with traffic regulations and control devices utilizing that portion of the sidewalk nearest the street but at no time more than half of the sidewalk a3 application a filing with chief of police a person seeking issuance of a parade permit shall file an application with the chief of police on forms provided by that officer b filing period an application for a parade permit shall be filed with the chief of police not less than ten days or more than 180 days before the date on which it is proposed to conduct the parade c contents the application for a parade permit shall set forth the following information 1 the name address and telephone number of the person seeking to conduct such parade 2 if the parade is proposed to be conducted for on behalf of or by an organization the name address and telephone number of the headquarters of the organization and of the authorized and responsible heads of such organization 3 the name address and telephone number of the person who will be the parade chairman and who will be responsible for its conduct 4 the date when the parade is to be conducted 5 the route to be traveled the starting point and the termination point 6 the approximate number of persons and animals and vehicles which will constitute such parade  the type of animals and description of the vehicles 7 the hours when such parade will start and terminate 8 a statement as to whether the parade will occupy all or only a portion of the width of the streets proposed to be traversed 9 the location by streets of any assembly areas for such parade 10 the time at which units of the parade will begin to assemble at any such assembly area 11 the interval of space to be maintained between units of such parade 12 if the parade is designed to be held by and on behalf of or for any person other than the applicant a communication in writing from the person proposing to hold the parade authorizing the applicant to apply for the permit on his behalf 13 any additional information which the chief of police shall find reasonably necessary to a fair determination as to whether a permit should issue 14 the names addresses and telephone numbers of persons who will act as parade marshals and who will be responsible for the conduct of portions or units of the parade and designating the portion or unit of the parade for which each is responsible a4 standards of issuance the chief of police shall issue a parade permit if upon considering the contents of the application and such other information as he may otherwise obtain he finds that 1 the time duration route and size of the parade will not unreasonably disrupt the movement of traffic 2 the parade or assembly is of the size and nature such that it will not require the diversion of so great a number of police officers to properly police the line of movement or assembly area or the areas contiguous thereto as to prevent reasonable police protection to the balance of the city 3 the concentration of persons animals and vehicles at the assembly points of the parade will not unduly interfere with the proper fire or police protection of or ambulance service to areas contiguous to such assembly areas 4 the parade will not cause such a concentration of persons animals or vehicles or a combination thereof such as to prevent proper police fire and ambulance services to the parade area or areas contiguous thereto 5 the parade is scheduled to move from its point of origin to its point of termination expeditiously and without unreasonable delays en route 6 the parade or assembly will not interfere with another parade or assembly for which a permit has been granted 7 the parade is not to be held for the sole purpose of advertising any product goods or event and is not decided to be held purely for private benefit 8 the conduct of the parade is not reasonably likely to cause injury to persons or property to provoke disorderly conduct or to create a disturbance 9 the permittee has provided for a sufficient number of parade marshals to control the orderly conduct of the parade or assembly in conformity with the parade permit a5 notice of action taken on application within three days after the filing of the application as required by this article the chief of police shall mail to the applicant a notice stating that the application 1 has been approved  2 will be approved upon the posting of a bond with the city stating the specific reasons a bond will be required and stating the amount of the bond based on a fair estimate of the amount required to indemnify the city for the cost incurred in maintaining the additional manpower necessary to secure control protect and manage the proposed parade  or 3 is denied and stating in detail the exact reasons for such denial a6 contents each parade permit shall state the following information 1 starting time 2 minimum speed 3 maximum speed 4 maximum interval of space to be maintained between the units of the parade 5 the portions of the street to be traversed that may be occupied by the parade 6 the maximum length of the parade in miles or fractions thereof 7 such other information conditions and directions as may be included by the chief of police to ensure that the parade will be conducted in conformance with the standards of issuance provided in section 24633 a9 alternative permit the chief of police in denying an application for a parade permit may notify the applicant that an alternative permit will be issued authorizing the conduct of a parade on a date at a time over a route or in some other manner different from that specified in the application an applicant desiring to accept an alternative permit shall within three days after notice of the action of the chief of police file a written notice of acceptance with the chef of police an alternative permit shall conform to the requirements of and shall have the effect of a parade permit under this article a8 revocation the chief of police shall have the authority to revoke a parade permit issued under this article when 1 there occurs any violation of the standards of issuance as set forth in section 24633 2 the information contained in the application for a parade permit is found to be false in any material detail 3 the permittee parade chairman any parade marshal or any other participant in such parade shall violate any applicable law or ordinance a12 appeal procedure any person aggrieved shall have the right to appeal the action taken under this article by the chief of police to the city council the appeal shall be taken within 15 days after the notice of the decision of the chief of police the city council shall act upon the appeal at its next regularly scheduled meeting but not later than 20 days from the time of receipt of the appeal a7 article 7  street names and addresses footnotes  6  state law reference authority to regulate the naming of streets nmsa 197  3491n purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this article is to 1 adopt consistent standards for street names and addresses in the city 2 expedite emergency utility and personal service provision orderly street name and address system 3 ensure street names are not duplicated or confused because of spelling pronunciation or alignment 4 ensure assignment and posting of specific street numbers to each property 5 provide an administrative procedure address required a all properties within the city or its address jurisdiction shall have a house number and street address assigned by the director of the community development department consisting of a street name and number designating its position relative to the address grid addresses shall be posted on all properties in accord with standards adopted by the city b each property owneroccupant shall place an assigned house number in a readily visible location upon the principal structures facing the street from which the property is addressed eg at the front entrance to the home or structure interior units of an apartment condominium project mobile home park or the like shall post the appropriate designation at each individual unit c house numbers shall be in numeric form at least three and onehalf inches in height and be posted in plain sight at least six feet above grade and in contrasting color to the background upon which they are mounted if the structure is set back from the principal roadway over 50 feet the address shall be posted at a driveway leading to the structure at least three feet above grade and in manner of color size and visibility specified above action once a street name change has been approved notice of such change shall be sent to all adjacent property owners and appropriate service and utility organizations new street signs shall be posted at appropriate locations b address number changes address number changes may be requested by the general public or by city staff the community development director shall review the proposed address number change to ensure that it conforms with established policies and then shall either approve or deny such request upon approval the community development director shall implement the address change by notifying the affected property owner or resident and all utility companies and service organizations by mail c appeals the administrative review board shall hear and render enforcement footnotes  2  cross reference administration ch 2 division 1  generally authority and duties of police and fire emergency services departments a it is the duty of police officers and such officers as may be assigned by the chief of police to enforce all city traffic regulations and all applicable state vehicle laws b police officers or such officers as may be assigned by the chief of police are authorized to direct all traffic by voice hand or signal in conformance with traffic laws and regulations if a fire or other emergency occurs they may direct as conditions require notwithstanding the traffic laws and regulations in order to expedite traffic or to safeguard pedestrians c officers of the fire emergency services department may direct or assist police in directing traffic at the scene of a fire or in its immediate vicinity d it shall be the further duty of the police department to perform the following with respect to this chapter 1 enforce traffic regulations applicable to street traffic  2 make arrests for traffic violations  3 investigate accidents  4 cooperate with the traffic engineer and other city officials in the administration of traffic laws and regulations and in developing methods to improve traffic conditions  and 5 carry out those duties imposed on it by this chapter e the police department may with the approval of the city manager establish a traffic division to perform the duties prescribed in subsection d of this section without further authorization  records of police department a the traffic division or the police department shall keep a record of traffic accidents warnings arrests convictions complaints and alleged violations of this chapter or state vehicle laws reported for each person within its this chapter or state vehicle laws  2 show all types of violations and the total of each type  and 3 accumulate during at least a fiveyear period and be maintained complete for at least the most recent fiveyear period d accident reports or cards referring to them shall be filed alphabetically by location whenever accidents in any particular location become numerous the police department or state law the officer finding such vehicle shall take its registration number and may take any other information displayed on the vehicle which may identify its user and shall conspicuously affix to such vehicle a traffic citation as set forth in section 1133 b if the alleged violator does not appear in response to a traffic citation affixed to a motor vehicle referred to in subsection a of this section within a period of five days a warrant and complaint shall be issued for the arrest of the registered owner of such vehicle at the time the alleged violation occurred pursuant to the presumptions provided for in this division c the traffic violations bureau shall prior to the issuance of the warrant and complaint send to such registered owner a letter or notice informing him of the violation and warning him that a warrant and complaint will issue if the matter is disregarded  presumption in reference to illegal parking in any prosecution charging a violation of any laws or regulations governing the stopping standing or parking of a vehicle proof that the particular vehicle described in the complaint was parked in violation of any such law or regulation together with proof that the defendant named in the complaint was at the time of such parking the registered owner of such vehicle shall constitute in evidence a prima facie presumption that the registered owner of such vehicle was the person who parked or placed such vehicle at the point where and for the time during which such violation occurred there shall be a prima facie presumption that the defendant named in the complaint was the registered owner if he is designated by the motor vehicle registration list  issue of arrest warrant for noncompliance if any person fails to comply with a traffic citation neighborhood parking zones authority the city council enacts this division pursuant to its police powers to provide for the general health safety and welfare of the general public  9898 short title this division sections 25466 inclusive shall be known as and may be cited as the neighborhood parking zone   9898 establishment of zones upon petition of residents whenever the residents constituting at least 75 percent of the total number of residents of a neighborhood petition the city manager to establish a special neighborhood parking zone having boundaries which are coextensive with the neighborhood as defined in the petition the city manager shall after the review set forth herein establish such zone modify the zone or deny the petition and the chief of police shall implement the decision of the city manager if approval to establish the neighborhood parking zone as requested by the petitioners shall include additional conditions restrictions or constitute a change to the defined zone the petitioners may by written consent of 75 percent of the residents agree to the additional conditions in which case the zone shall be established in accordance with the recommendations of the city manager should 75 percent of the petitioners fail to accept the decision of the city manager or should the city manager deny the petition the petitioners may within 15 days of the decision appeal the decision to the city council by delivering a written notice of the appeal to the city clerk  9898 contents of petition in order to request the establishment of a neighborhood parking zone the residents of a neighborhood shall present a written petition to the city manager the petition shall include a description of the affected area a statement of the need for a restricted neighborhood parking zone a description of the proposed terms and conditions of the zone and shall designate a representative of the petitioners to whom all future communications should be addressed the petition shall as of the date of its submission to the city manager have appended to it a verified list of all residents of the affected area the petition shall be signed by at least 75 percent of the residents within the affected area and shall identify by address the property of each signatory the signatures need not be acknowledged for the purposes of determining if the requisite number of signatures have been obtained each dwelling and each nonresidential parcel shall be considered as being entitled to one signature  9898 terms of neighborhood zones in seeking to establish a neighborhood parking zone the residents shall propose the periods when parking is to be restricted the means of identifying vehicles owned by residents who may park on the street during restricted hours the number of nonresident parking permits if any which may be issued to each resident and the desired means of identifying nonresident vehicles as having permits allowing them to park within the zone  9898 review of petition in reviewing a petition for the establishment of a neighborhood parking zone the city manager shall make inquiry of the community development division and police department to determine if sufficient evidence of the need to establish such a zone exists the impact of such zone on surrounding neighborhoods and whether the zone could reasonably be enforced the traffic engineering administrator shall determine whether the area can be reasonably marked as having restricted parking and whether the hours of the restrictions are reasonable the city manager may contact such other departments as may be deemed appropriate in order to seek their opinions as to whether or not the zone should be created and if any additional terms or conditions are advisable  9898 expenses of establishing zones the city manager shall have the discretion to determine whether or not the petitioners shall be required to bear the costs of establishing such a neighborhood parking zone in the event that such reimbursement is to be required the city manager may consider the cost of installation of all signage and the cost of the means of identifying vehicles as being permitted to park within the zone the city manager may require the petitioners to make satisfactory arrangements for such reimbursement prior to the establishment of the zone and may require the residents to pay a reasonable fee not to exceed $300 per permit to reimburse the city for the actual costs of processing and issuing each vehicular permit lost permits may be replaced only by payment of a fee not to exceed $1000  9898 illegal parking within zones it shall be a violation of this division to park on the street in a neighborhood parking zone without displaying the appropriate temporary or permanent permit to park therein it shall be an affirmative defense to the violation of this division that the vehicle is owned by a resident of the neighborhood and that a permit has been obtained for that vehicle within five days of the date of the violation  9898 penalties the penalties established for violations of the terms of a neighborhood parking zone are as follows 1 for a first offense a fine of $500 2 for a second offense within a 12month period a fine of $5000 3 for a third and subsequent offense within a 12month period a fine of $7500 4 the municipal court shall have the authority to suspend the fine on a first offense but may not defer the conviction 5 in the event of a third or subsequent offense within a 12month period the vehicle shall be towed or immobilized the vehicle shall not be released until the traffic division of the farmington municipal court has provided clearance stating that all outstanding fines and fees including the cost of immobilizing or towing the vehicle have been paid an immobilized vehicle may subsequently be removed from the neighborhood 6 for the purposes of this section violations of the neighborhood parking zone shall be charged to the vehicle owner and not to the driver 7 the fines established herein are exclusive of any mandatory fees which are required to be collected by the farmington municipal court  9898 establishment of zone upon petition by city in the event that any department or division of the city deems it advisable to establish a neighborhood parking zone without the initiation of a petition by the residents of the affected area a petition may be filed with the planning and zoning commission to establish the same the petition shall contain all of the information required by section 25469 with the exception of the requirement of the residents signature the petition shall be considered in the same manner as an application for change in zoning and all proceedings thereon shall be governed by the unified development the the city of farmington  9898   administration the administration of all neighborhood parking zones shall be the responsibility of the chief of police or his designee as used herein the term administration includes the issuance and revocation of permits the establishment and dissolution of neighborhood parking zones the enforcement of all terms and conditions established for any zone and the installation of appropriate signs by the traffic division  9898 modification or dissolution of zone a neighborhood parking zone may be modified or dissolved upon petition of the residents or upon petition of the city in either event the procedures set forth in this division shall apply  9898 article 5  pedestrians footnotes  9  state law reference or local parking or motor vehicle laws may remove or cause to be removed any vehicle within the corporate limits without prior notice to the owner or operator thereof when 1 any vehicle is left driving or in control of the vehicle for an alleged offense and the officer is by ordinance or by law required or permitted to take and does take the person arrested before a municipal judge without unnecessary delay 8 an abandoned unattended wrecked burned or partially dismantled vehicle is creating a traffic hazard because of its position in relation to the street alley or public way or its physical location is causing the impeding of traffic 9 the use of the street alley or public way or any portion thereof is authorized by the city for a purpose other than the normal flow of traffic or for the movement of equipment articles or structures of unusual size and the parking of any vehicle would prohibit or interfere with such use of movement and signs giving notice that such vehicle may be removed are erected or placed within at least 24 hours prior to the removal 10 any vehicle is parked or left standing where prohibited by ordinance or other state or local law provided that no vehicle may be removed unless signs are posted giving notice of the removal at least 24 hours prior to the removal 11 the vehicle is parked or standing in a manner so as to obstruct necessary emergency services rerouting of traffic at the scene of a disaster and moving the vehicle to a legal parking location is impractical however the owner or operator of a vehicle so relocated or removed shall not be subject to any relocation removal or storage charge if the vehicle is otherwise lawfully parked such charges shall be paid by the city b whenever a vehicle could be relocated or removed and the driver of the vehicle is present the police officer or authorized employee may if that person is not incapacitated order the driver to move that vehicle to another location  abandoned vehicles note  adopted apr 22 200 repealed the former div 2  2623126236 and enacted a new div 2 as set out herein the former div 2 pertained to similar subject matter for complete derivation see the table at the end of this volume declaration of an emergency if a water shortage occurs in the city water system due to conditions of drought lack of rainfall or snowpack damage to the water system or facilities failure of a key system component or facility or due to civil or other emergency the city council may implement water conservation measures based upon the stages contained within this division the city council upon consultation with the city manager shall determine when each stage is to be implemented based on the operational requirements of the system and estimated water supply and demand projections implementation of the stages need not be sequential and the duration of each stage will be determined by the city council upon consultation with the city manager  42203 notice of water conservation stages upon declaration by the city council of any of the stages described within this division which require water conservation measures the city manager or his designee shall publish a notice describing such action at least once in a daily newspaper having the greatest circulation within the city one copy of such notice and proof of publication shall be filed with the city clerk the city manager or his designee shall also give notice to the local news media television and radio broadcasting stations and use such other means that reasonably may be available to notify water customers of required water conservation actions notice of termination of any stage shall be given in the same manner  42203 establishment of water conservation stages a the following water conservation stages are hereby established 1 stage 1  water shortage advisory 2 stage 2  water shortage watch 3 stage 3  water shortage warning 4 stage 4  water shortage emergency b some or all of the following guidelines may be used by the city council in determining when it would be appropriate to establish each water conservation stage  1 stage 1  water shortage advisory  water use reduction goal   ten percent a snowpack levels in the basin are or projected to be below 50 percent of average  b projected instream flow levels in the animas and san juan rivers are expected to be below 50 percent of average  c water storage level of the citys reservoir farmington lake is less than 75 percent of normal for the time of year  d the palmer drought index indicates severe to extreme drought for the animas river and san juan river basins  or e the existence of other conditions such as failure of a key system component or civil emergency which the city council determines may negatively impact water supply 2 stage 2  water shortage watch  water use reduction goal   15 percent a water storage level of the citys reservoir farmington lake is below 80 percent of capacity and the influenteffluent ratio ie the ratio of the amount of water entering into system or storage and the amount of water leaving the system distribution or evaporation is projected to be between 50 percent and 80 percent over the next 30 days or more  or b the stage 1 water reduction goal of ten percent has not been met after being in place for a reasonable period of time 3 stage 3  water shortage warning  water use reduction goal   35 percent a water storage level of the citys reservoir farmington lake is below 80 percent of capacity and the influenteffluent ratio is projected to be below 50 percent over the next 30 days or more  or b water storage level of the citys reservoir farmington lake is below 65 percent of capacity and the influenteffluent ratio is projected to be below 80 percent over the next 30 days or more  or c the stage 2 water reduction goal of 15 percent has not been met after being in place for a reasonable period of time 4 stage 4  water shortage emergency  water use reduction goal   50 percent a water storage level of the citys reservoir farmington lake is below 50 percent of capacity and the influenteffluent ratio is projected to be below 150 percent over the next 30 days or more  or b failure of a major system component which significantly affects the water systems ability to meet demand  or c the stage 3 water reduction goal of 35 percent has not been met after being in place for a reasonable period of time  42203 stage 1  water shortage advisory the following voluntary water conservation measures shall be in effect once a stage 1 water shortage advisory has been declared by the city council 1 landscape or lawn watering should be limited in such a manner so as to reduce overall water usage by at least ten percent 2 landscape or lawn watering with automated sprinkler systems between the hours of  am to  pm is discouraged landscape or lawn watering with manual sprinkler systems between the hours of  noon to  pm is discouraged 3 watering early in the morning is recommended to avoid excess evaporation and discourage fungus growth and lawns should be aerated to improve absorption and reduce runoff lawn watering should be done only when the lawn needs watering 4 sprinkler systems should be shut off when it is raining 5 fugitive water which overflows the landscaped area being watered and leaves the property is discouraged 6 landscape and lawn watering should be stopped when winds are strong enough to cause the water to leave the area being watered 7 installation of new landscaping is discouraged and if any new plant material is installed only drought resistant or lowwateruse plants should be used mulch should be placed around all existing plants trees shrubs or flower gardens to hold moisture in the soil 8 washing of hard surfaces such as parking lots driveways or sidewalks is discouraged 9 indoor and outdoor leaks should be repaired immediately upon discovery 10 filling of swimming pools or hot tubs is discouraged swimming pools and hot tubs should be covered when not in use 11 outdoor use of water for recreational purposes is discouraged 12 restaurants should be encouraged to provide water to customers only upon request 13 hotels motels and other lodging facilities are requested to promote water conservation by encouraging guests to minimize use of towels and not changing bed linens for multinight stays except once every four days 14 ornamental fountains with recirculated water may be operated only when winds do not exceed 12 mph ornamental fountains without recirculated water are discouraged 15 use of fire hydrants should be limited to firefighting use and use of fire hydrants for other purposes discouraged unless metered 16 car washing at residences is discouraged all hoses used for landscape watering car washing or other uses should be equipped with a shut off nozzle 17 car washing at self serve car washes is encouraged and businesses that wash vehicles are encouraged to use high pressure wash systems 18 water users are encouraged to replace old plumbing fixtures with low flow fixtures such as low flow showerheads faucets and toilets or retrofit existing fixtures with low flow devices such as toilet tank dams waterfilled plastic jugs or a brick 19 water users are encouraged to take shorter showers  not to let the water run continuously while brushing teeth or shaving  and to flush only when necessary 20 appliances which use water such as dishwashers and clothes washers should be run only with full loads 21 evaporative coolers should be run only when needed and have a thermostat to control their operation evaporative coolers that bleed off water should be replaced with an evaporative cooler that uses recirculated water 22 hot water heaters should be insulated  the temperature set appropriately  and partially drained once per year 23 outdoor open burning which requires water to be available for extinguishment is discouraged 24 new accounts for bulk sale of water are permitted but with contract language to curtail use in other stages 25 treated water bulk sales contracts shall be encouraged to be reduced or diminished by ten percent based on the same month of the preceding year or at a percentage which is in the same ratio or proportion as the supply by the citys own customers is being reduced or diminished whichever is greater until the stage 1 restrictions are lifted  42203 stage 2  water shortage watch the following mandatory water conservation measures shall be in effect once a stage 2 water shortage watch has been declared by the city council 1 landscape or lawn watering shall be restricted to tuesday thursday and saturday for locations with even numbered addresses and to wednesday friday and sunday for locations with odd numbered addresses 2 landscape or lawn watering with automated sprinkler systems shall be prohibited between the hours of  am to  pm landscape or lawn watering with manual sprinkler systems shall be prohibited between the hours of  noon to  pm 3 sprinkler systems shall be shut off when it is raining 4 fugitive water which overflows the landscaped area being watered and leaves the property is prohibited 5 landscape and lawn watering shall be stopped when winds are strong enough to cause the water to leave the area being watered 6 installation of new landscaping is discouraged until stage 2 restrictions are lifted 7 water waste by leaks or inefficient sprinklers is prohibited indoor and outdoor leaks or improperly operating sprinklers shall be repaired immediately upon discovery 8 washing of hard surfaces such as parking lots driveways or sidewalks is prohibited except in emergencies as determined by the fire department to remove spills of hazardous materials or to eliminate dangerous conditions which threaten the public health safety or welfare 9 filling of swimming pools for private use after declaration of stage 2 restrictions is prohibited private swimming pools and spas already filled may be kept full but shall not be emptied and refilled and must be covered when not in use filling refilling and covering restrictions shall not apply to public pools and spas including those at hotels motels and private clubs 10 restaurants shall be required to provide water to customers only upon request 11 hotels motels and other lodging facilities shall be requested to promote water conservation by encouraging guests to minimize use of towels and not changing bed linens for multinight stays except once every four days 12 ornamental fountains with recirculated water may be operated only when winds are not strong enough to cause water to leave the fountain ornamental fountains without recirculated water are prohibited 13 use of fire hydrants should be limited to firefighting use and use of fire hydrants for other purposes discouraged unless metered outdoor open burning which requires water to be available for extinguishment is prohibited 14 car washing at residences and fund raising car washes at commercial businesses are discouraged all hoses used for landscape watering car washing or other uses shall be equipped with a shut off nozzle 15 car washing at self serve car washes is permitted and businesses that wash vehicles are encouraged to use high pressure wash systems 16 adherence to all of the voluntary measures set forth in the stage 1 water shortage advisory that are not made mandatory by stage 2 is highly encouraged 17 new contracts for treated water bulk sales are prohibited 18 treated water bulk sales contracts shall be reduced or diminished by 15 percent based on the same month of the preceding year or at a percentage which is in the same ratio or proportion as the supply by the citys own customers is reduced or diminished whichever is greater until the stage 2 restrictions are lifted  42203 stage 3  water shortage warning the following mandatory water conservation measures shall be in effect once a stage 3 water of sale to establish the commencement date for such exemption newly installed seed or sod lawns shall be exempted from the specified day watering schedule but are not exempted from the hours of the day when watering is permitted as provided for elsewhere in this chapter installation of new lawn or landscaping during stage 3 and stage 4 is prohibited 2 the watering of athletic or playing fields and other heavily used public areas and of tees and greens at golf courses is not restricted to the days and times specified herein but may only be conducted under a permit from the water utility after submission of a watering plan which minimizes water use and conforms as much as is reasonably possible to the requirements of the stage in effect 3 the time of day watering restrictions shall not apply to hand watering or drip irrigation of vegetable and flower gardens trees or shrubs however the day of week watering restrictions in effect at the time still must be observed lawn watering may not be done in this manner between the hours of  noon and  pm and water waste is prohibited hand watering shall mean holding in the hand a hose with a positive shutoff nozzle attached and does not include operating a hose with a sprinkler or manually operating an irrigation controller 4 the time of day and day of week water use restrictions shall not apply to any person firm or corporation engaged in the business of growing or selling plants of any kind but such uses shall be required to comply with all other water conservation measures specified in each stage 5 water treatment plants and wastewater treatment plants are exempt from this division in its maintenance practices of washing down and back flushing of equipment using treated water essential to the proper and safe operation of the treatment plant electric power generating plants are exempt from this division for treated water it uses for makeup and cooling tower purposes that are essential for the proper safe and full operation of the plant 6 homes commercial establishments and governmental entities that have large landscaped areas where daily active use water pressure limitations or inadequate irrigation equipment that restricts the owners ability to irrigate within the time limits specified within any of the stages may develop an irrigation plan to designate a portion of its landscape area as even or odd for the purpose of complying with the water use restrictions and shall submit such plan to the water department for approval 7 individuals or entities that own irrigation ditch rights or private wells for irrigating lands also served by city water are exempt from the water use restrictions but are encouraged to use such water prior to using city water and are encouraged to comply with the time of day specified day restrictions and fugitive water provisions of this division  42203 enforcement of water conservation restrictions it shall be unlawful for any person to use water during any of the stages described within this division which require mandatory water conservation measures and which violates the requirements of such stages or which violates any termination or turnoff order or which violates any water rationing system enforcement of the water conservation restrictions specified in stages 2 3 or 4 shall be by the police department or a code compliance officer in the following manner 1 the first violation shall result in the issuance of a notice of violation to the party committing said violation and to the water customer if the person committing the violation is not the water customer the notice of violation shall advise the party of the nature of the violation and the section of this division of the city has been violated the offender and the water customer shall be provided with an educational packet containing information describing the water conservation stage in effect 2 upon observation of a second violation or upon reasonable cause to believe that a second violation has occurred unless otherwise specified elsewhere in this chapter a citation shall be issued to the party violating this section of the city the party of the specific violations observed and the penalty to be imposed fees required to be paid as a penalty for violation of the provisions of this division shall be paid as a surcharge upon the water bill of the regular water customer or shall be due as an assessment to the city by the person who committed the violation in the case the offender is not a regular water customer the penalties for second and subsequent violations shall be as specified in section 26240 of the city  42203 penalties for violation of water use restrictions a all violations of stage 2 3 or 4 water use restrictions shall be under the jurisdiction of the water conservation hearing officer who shall be the city manager or such other persons designated by the city manager to serve as an impartial arbitrators at any hearings related to the enforcement of this chapter any person firm or corporation who is determined to have violated any required provision of this division shall be required to pay the following fees stage 2  water shortage watch first assessed a penalty or surcharge under this chapter and desires to appeal such penalty or surcharge shall submit a written request for a hearing before the water conservation hearing officer to the city of farmington customer service division such written request shall be submitted within ten calendar days from the date of receipt of the notice of violation in the case of a penalty or in the case of a surcharge within ten calendar days from the date of the postmark of the most recent utility bill b upon scheduling the hearing the water customer shall be given written notice of the hearing by personal delivery or certified or registered mail deposited in the mail to the last known address of the customer or violator at least ten calendar days before the hearing c all hearings shall be open to the public and shall be held only after notice has been provided to the water customer as provided for in this chapter notice of the hearing shall be posted in the lobby of city hall at least 72 hours prior to the time of the hearing d conduct of the hearing 1 the hearing shall be conducted by the water conservation hearing officer hereinafter hearing officer 2 formal rules of evidence shall not apply to the conduct of the hearing 3 crossquestioning is neither prohibited nor encouraged the hearing officer shall have full discretion whether to allow it 4 the hearing officer may hear testimony from any witness 5 after calling the hearing to order the hearing officer shall outline the procedure to be followed in the conduct of the hearing 6 the hearing may be recessed or adjourned to another time andor place upon the discretion of the hearing officer e at the hearing the hearing officer may consider such factors as the steps the water user has taken to correct the violation  any unusual or unique circumstances that may have contributed to the violation having occurred  any extraordinary hardship caused by the imposition of such penalties  and any other relevant information presented by the water customer collection of the penalty shall be held in abeyance during the pendency of any hearing the hearing officer shall have the authority to suspend or cancel all or part of the penalty imposed for such violation if the hearing officer determines that the penalty was inappropriately imposed or that the water customer has taken reasonable steps to prevent reoccurrence of such violation the hearing officer shall make a record of the proceeding which shall include findings of fact and conclusions of law f the decision of the hearing officer may be appealed to the board of public utility commissioners the board of public utility commissioners shall conduct a public hearing on the appeal in a manner similar to the procedure followed by the hearing officer described in this section at the appeal hearing the board of public utility commissioners shall review the record created by the hearing officer and may consider such other factors as the steps the water user has taken to correct the violation  any unusual or unique circumstances that may have contributed to the violation having occurred  any extraordinary hardship caused by the imposition of such penalties  and any other relevant information presented by the water customer collection of the penalty shall be held in abeyance during the pendency of any hearing the board of public utility commissioners shall have the authority to suspend or cancel all or part of the penalty imposed for such violation if the board determines that the penalty was inappropriately imposed or that the water customer has taken reasonable steps to prevent reoccurrence of such violation the board of public utility commissioners shall make a record of the proceeding which shall include findings of fact and conclusions of law the decision of the board of public utility commissioners is the final step in the administrative procedures and is conclusive upon the water customer or violator any water customer or violator shall be considered to have exhausted all available administrative remedies upon issuance of the decision by the board of public utility commissioners any customer or violator aggrieved by the decision of the board of public utility commissioners may appeal such decision to district court  42203 secs 2624226265  reserved division 3  irrigation water ditches and laterals footnotes  4  state law reference authority of city regarding canals and ditches nmsa 197  3534 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning director means the director of the water and wastewater department or the employee or designee appointed by the city manager to carry out the responsibility contemplated by this division community ditch means a community ditch ditch company or acequia existing under nmsa 197  73328 or under the state statutes for the purpose of transporting irrigation water from a river to a lateral irrigation water means and includes any raw untreated water transported community ditch and into a lateral intended to be used for watering of lawns gardens fields parks orchards or similar uses irrigation water does not include stormwater or floodwater lateral means and includes any ditch or pipe used for the conveyance of irrigation water which extends or emanates from a community ditch user means any person who has a lawful right to receive and use irrigation water from a lateral  cross reference definitions generally  112 policy it is the intent of this division to ensure that persons who receive irrigation water within the city shall bear the expense of maintaining the laterals and that other residents are not required to subsidize the expense of providing irrigation water laterals shall be maintained according to standards established by the city  map of laterals and list of users for the purpose of this division the director shall prepare and maintain maps of all laterals within the city and shall prepare and maintain a list of all irrigation water users within the city which shall be available for inspection by the public  maintenance of laterals by users  association of users a under this division it is the duty and responsibility of all users of irrigation water to clean and maintain the laterals used to transport irrigation water city or to any premises within the city unless the maintenance of such ditches and laterals has been assumed by the city b the director may require that all users upon a lateral form an association of users on the lateral and that one representative or an alternate representative be elected and designated by the users to deal with the city as the representative of users on the lateral in dealings between the city and the users in matters which pertain to the lateral  payment for irrigation water users from laterals in addition to the obligation to maintain laterals set forth in this division shall pay for the use of irrigation raw water at the rates specified in this chapter for irrigation raw water unless the user is the owner or lessee of a valid water right the city may require the user to file proof of the users water right with the city  reasonable rules for equitable use of water under this division the director may prescribe reasonable rules and regulations pertaining to the use of waters from laterals to ensure that the waters will be made equitably available to users on the lateral such rules shall be submitted to the city council for adoption and shall be revised from time to time as required  contamination it is unlawful for any person to intentionally contaminate poison or pollute any lateral or any water in a lateral  refusal to maintain lateral it is unlawful for any person who has a duty to maintain a lateral within the city to fail or refuse to clean or maintain such lateral  obstruction of laterals it is unlawful for any person other than for the purpose of lawfully obtaining water therefrom to obstruct any lateral in the city which is used for the purpose of transporting irrigation water within the city or to dump refuse or rubbish as defined in section 2311 into any such lateral  unlawful use of water it is unlawful for any person who does not have a legal right to use or withdraw steal divert or take water from a lateral  obedience to rules it is unlawful for any person to refuse to obey reasonable rules and regulations promulgated by the director and approved by the city council for equitable use of water from laterals  assumption of maintenance of certain laterals by city the city acting director may in its discretion undertake the maintenance of any lateral within the city when users on such lateral request city maintenance and the city deems it in the best interest of the city to undertake such maintenance or if the director shall determine that the city must maintain such lateral due to the failure or refusal of one or more of the users to keep and maintain such lateral according to city standards  procedure for assumption of maintenance  notice to users if the director determines that is necessary for the city to maintain a lateral or any part thereof due to the failure or refusal of one or more users to maintain the lateral according to standards established by the city the director shall cause a notice to be served upon the user of the lateral the notice shall notify the user that a determination has been made that the city must assume maintenance of the lateral due to the failure of the user to maintain the lateral according to city standards that the cost thereof shall be assessed against the user and that the city shall perform such maintenance and assess the cost thereof to the user after the expiration of 30 days from the date of such notice to the user unless the user shall appeal such determination by the director to the administrative review board within 30 days from the users receipt of the notice  notice of city maintenance the notice of maintenance to be performed by the city referenced in section 26278 shall be duly served upon the user of the lateral if the user cannot be personally served with the notice a copy thereof shall be posted at the entrance of the principal building or structure located upon the premises which receives irrigation water from the lateral and a copy shall be sent to the last known address of the user by certified mail return receipt requested  protest and appeal under this division it shall be the duty of each and every user to effect the maintenance upon the lateral described in the notice within the time prescribed in the notice unless the user shall file a protest and notice of appeal from the determination of the director with the administrative review board pursuant to section 2440 if the user files an appeal to the administrative review board the director shall withhold action upon his determination pending outcome of the appeal unless failure on the part of the city to maintain the lateral will endanger the public health safety and welfare  standards and specifications for lateral maintenance the director shall promulgate and develop standard specifications for maintenance of laterals within the city such standards and specifications shall be submitted to the city council for review following approval by the city council laterals in the city shall be maintained in accordance with such standards such standard specifications shall be periodically reviewed and updated  annual determination of maintenance costs  proposed assessment list the director shall annually prepare and submit to the city council an estimate of the cost which will be required to maintain laterals within the city along with a list of costs proposed to be assessed against each user for lateral maintenance the proposed assessment list shall be in writing and shall include at least the following information 1 a description of lateral for which assessment is to be made 2 the name and address of each user on the lateral 3 a description of property to be served from the lateral 4 the amount of the proposed assessment 5 elements of cost which were used to determine the assessment 6 the basis or formula used to calculate the assessment to each user 7 other pertinent information  review and approval of assessment by council the city council shall review the estimate of costs and the list of proposed assessments prepared in accordance with section 26282 and shall make such changes additions or corrections as it deems necessary  notice and hearing on assessments  protest on or before the first monday in april of each year a copy of the assessment to be made against each user of a lateral shall be mailed to each user at the last known address of the user each user shall be notified as part of the assessment that any user who wishes to object to the assessment or to the manner or method of its calculation may appeal to the administrative review board by filing a protest in the office of the city clerk within 15 days of the users receipt of the assessment a user may protest the proceedings the assessment roll or the assessment made to the user a user may not protest upon the grounds that the assessment creates a personal or economic hardship for the user  hearing on protest the administrative review board shall hear and determine all protests under this division pursuant to the procedures established in section 2440 persons aggrieved by a decision of the administrative review board may appeal to the city council as specified in section 2440 any assessment made under this division shall be held in abeyance pending the outcome of protest proceedings provided that interest shall accrue upon the assessment as provided in section 26287  review by district court any user may petition the district court for review of an assessment made under this division within 30 days after exhausting administrative remedies before the administrative review board and before the city council  assessment due date  interest assessments rendered under this division are due and payable to the city 30 days after notice of the assessment is sent to the user interest shall accrue on unpaid assessments at the rate of 12 percent per annum from the due date until paid  payment of assessments for capital improvements in annual installments a under this division a user may elect to pay that portion of an assessment which is for capital improvements in annual installments of not less than ten percent of the value of the improvement each year plus interest on the unpaid amount of the assessment at the rate specified in section 26287 provided that any annual payment allowed upon the capital improvement portion of the assessment under this section excluding interest except for the final payment shall not be less than $18000 b a user who elects to pay the capital improvement portion of an assessment in annual installments must file a written notice of such election in the office of the city clerk within 30 days of the date of the first notice of assessment for a particular capital improvement 1 lien for assessment  foreclosure assessments made pursuant to this division shall constitute a lien against the property served which may be perfected and foreclosed upon as provided by nmsa 197  31825 and 3361 et seq  delinquent assessment or water payment under this division it is unlawful for any user who is delinquent in payment of an assessment for lateral maintenance or who is delinquent in payment of charges for irrigation water to use water from a lateral  termination of water use for delinquency the director shall terminate delivery of irrigation water to any user who is delinquent in payment of an assessment due under this division or who is delinquent in payment of charges for irrigation water
